quotation.p: All quotation marks and apostrophes have been changed: " for “," for ”, ' for ‘, and ' for ’.

Because of web browser variability, all hyphens have been typed on the U.S. keyboard.
Dashes have been rendered as a variable number of hyphens to give a more exact rendering of their length.

normalization.p: Southey's spelling has not been regularized.
Writing in other hands appearing on these manuscripts has been indicated as such, the content recorded in brackets.
& has been used for the ampersand sign.

All other characters, those with accents, non-breaking spaces, etc., have been encoded in HTML entity decimals.

div.head:
3341. Robert Southey to William Lowther, 1st Earl of Lonsdale, 2 August 1819 MS: Cumbria Record Office, Carlisle, DLons/L1/2/60a. ALS; 1p.
Unpublished.
div.p: A long standing engagement takes me into Scotland next week, to visit the Caledonian Canal, with Mr Telford & Mr Rickman.Southey’s tour of Scotland lasted from 17 August until 1 October 1819. For his record of events, see Journal of a Tour in Scotland in 1819, ed. Charles Harold Herford (1929). Both my companions being men of business, my absence will not be long, – & it will give me great pleasure to obey your Lordships summons should I return in time.
